page.title: 09STUDENT LIFE STYLES
page.content: 3. 17s TO 25s. All are single, mainly British. 55% are students. Of those with jobs, none commute to London but are employed locally as accountants, silk screen printers, dental nurses etc..They have 4 times as many 'O'-levels as CSEs, most having 6 or more 'O'-levels and some form of further education. The majority still live with parents and have always lived in the area. A high proportion participate in regular sport, the most popular being swimming, tennis, squash, jogging and walking. Most visit libraries and museums regularly and the cinema 5 to 10 times a year. Regular hobbies are DIY, piano playing, drawing, sketching, singing and reading. There is little voluntary work, but some help in hospitals and with brownie packs. Parties,discos and visits to pubs. are popular.
